user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtList_DeleteNode:
```c
void UtList_DeleteNode(UtListNode_t *DeleteNode)
{
    UtList_Extract(DeleteNode);

    /* non-data/header nodes shouldn't be free()'ed */
    if (DeleteNode->Data != NULL)
    {
        free(DeleteNode);
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (DeleteNode->Data != NULL)
    {
        free(DeleteNode);
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: the free(DeleteNode) call is executed conditionally when DeleteNode->Data != NULL, so the code is reachable when that condition can be true. This only violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 if program invariants guarantee DeleteNode->Data is always NULL at this point (for example, if UtList_Extract always sets DeleteNode->Data = NULL or callers only pass nodes with Data == NULL), in which case the conditional body would be unreachable.
